intro: Centaurium spicatum var. racemosum, commonly known as the racemose centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its showy, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. The inflorescence is a raceme, which is a type of flowering cluster where flowers are borne on short pedicels along a central axis.
